28cbaa03-9f3d-458c-abd3-6485bf567707.description: Earners of the Project Management Tools microcredential have demonstrated competency in project management software to develop and report a project plan. Earners have completed project management tasks using industry-standard software systems. Earners define project outlines and schedules, populate task lists, assign resources to those tasks, and determine critical path. Generate reports and charts designed to track project progress and communicate project information.
28cbaa03-9f3d-458c-abd3-6485bf567707.name: Project Management Tools

issuer.summary: issued by Northern Alberta Institute of Technology

badge_template_activities.title: Earners must demonstrate competency at an industry entry level by completing a meaningful assessment that includes real-world application.

c445c0c8-3468-410b-b865-df91a61e354f.description: Earners of the Project Charter Development microcredential have demonstrated competency in the development of a project charter. Participants define project parameters such as rationale, benefits, key deliverables, assumptions, risks and constraints, budget, organization, and governance structures. Additional topics include formal acceptance procedures, scope change control, scope verification, and differences between internal projects and those managed through third party organizations.
c445c0c8-3468-410b-b865-df91a61e354f.name: Project Charter Development

issuer.summary: issued by Northern Alberta Institute of Technology

badge_template_activities.title: Earners must demonstrate competency at an industry entry level by completing a meaningful assessment that includes real-world application.

8b55940d-89dc-4734-ada0-144d0f53a34d.description: Earners of the Project Schedule Management microcredential have demonstrated competency in project network diagram and Gantt chart including calculations to indicate the critical path. The concepts and processes essential for timely completion of projects application of tools such as sequencing, activity duration estimating, and identification of milestones to develop a project schedule, calculation of the project critical path, and techniques for project fast tracking and project crashing.
8b55940d-89dc-4734-ada0-144d0f53a34d.name: Project Schedule Management

issuer.summary: issued by Northern Alberta Institute of Technology

badge_template_activities.title: Earners must demonstrate competency at an industry entry level by completing a meaningful assessment that includes real-world application.

023fb808-35eb-43ac-ab11-7ac4bd942a4d.description: Earners of the Team Building & Facilitation microcredential have demonstrated competency in applying strategies and tools to build and lead high performance teams. This includes methods for understanding and shaping team dynamics toward attainment of project outcomes. Analysis of team development and dynamics, conflict resolution strategies, and tools for planning and conducting effective and efficient team meetings.
023fb808-35eb-43ac-ab11-7ac4bd942a4d.name: Team Building & Facilitation

issuer.summary: issued by Northern Alberta Institute of Technology

badge_template_activities.title: Earners must demonstrate competency at an industry entry level by completing a meaningful assessment that includes real-world application.

564f6798-00fa-4c16-abcb-6c84452b04d2.description: Earners of The Productivity and Continuous Improvement microcredential have demonstrated competency in the application of tools, techniques, and strategies to make projects and teams more effective and efficient. This includes: the value of continuous improvement, barriers to productivity, building cooperative relationships and dealing with difficult people, and the use of process flowcharts and related tools to identify the cause of project challenges and plan for adjustment and improvement.
564f6798-00fa-4c16-abcb-6c84452b04d2.name: Productivity and Continuous Improvement

issuer.summary: issued by Northern Alberta Institute of Technology

badge_template_activities.title: Earners must demonstrate competency at an industry entry level by completing a meaningful assessment that includes real-world application.

68cc6b01-eeec-46e3-9d86-da855bd2d4ca.description: Earners of the Project Cost Management microcredential have demonstrated competency in the application of concepts and processes essential for control of costs while delivering high-quality, on-schedule projects. These include financial metrics, resource planning, estimating/budgeting techniques, development of cost baselines, and earned value calculations.
68cc6b01-eeec-46e3-9d86-da855bd2d4ca.name: Project Cost Management

issuer.summary: issued by Northern Alberta Institute of Technology

badge_template_activities.title: Earners must demonstrate competency at an industry entry level by completing a meaningful assessment that includes real-world application.

eb73cfc5-22c1-46af-96e6-fca8d70f5125.description: Earners of the Project Human Resource Management microcredential have demonstrated competency in the application of human resource skills necessary to provide leadership, motivation, and conflict resolution skills to a project team. These include assignment of project roles and responsibilities, organization and reporting relationships, staff recruitment and orientation, goal setting, performance management, and conflict resolution.
eb73cfc5-22c1-46af-96e6-fca8d70f5125.name: Project Human Resource Management

issuer.summary: issued by Northern Alberta Institute of Technology

badge_template_activities.title: Earners must demonstrate competency at an industry entry level by completing a meaningful assessment that includes real-world application.

97cd17f1-d03d-488e-8257-ad5a928261db.description: Earners of the Project Communications Management microcredential have demonstrated competency in the application of techniques that contribute to effective project communication. These include analysis of project communications, identification and resolution of communication barriers, developing clear and concise written and verbal communications, assessment of stakeholder needs at different project stages, and delivering effective presentations.
97cd17f1-d03d-488e-8257-ad5a928261db.name: Project Communications Management

issuer.summary: issued by Northern Alberta Institute of Technology

badge_template_activities.title: Earners must demonstrate competency at an industry entry level by completing a meaningful assessment that includes real-world application.

cf7af799-c0ac-494a-b900-7ace70fc3df3.description: Earners of the Project Procurement Management microcredential have demonstrated competency in the application of skills required to manage the procurement of goods and services required for completion of projects. These include procurement planning, solicitations, source selection, contract negotiation and administration, and contract close-out.
cf7af799-c0ac-494a-b900-7ace70fc3df3.name: Project Procurement Management

issuer.summary: issued by Northern Alberta Institute of Technology

badge_template_activities.title: Earners must demonstrate competency at an industry entry level by completing a meaningful assessment that includes real-world application.

e4880090-5424-4344-bbd4-0959b320b7fe.description: Earners of the Project Risk Management microcredential have demonstrated competency in the application of skills required to identify and manage project risk factors. These include risk identification, qualitative and quantitative analysis, documentation, and risk response planning.
e4880090-5424-4344-bbd4-0959b320b7fe.name: Project Risk Management

issuer.summary: issued by Northern Alberta Institute of Technology

badge_template_activities.title: Earners must demonstrate competency at an industry entry level by completing a meaningful assessment that includes real-world application.

90a7e15a-32bf-4aaf-9286-137d47fc6100.description: Earners of the Project Quality Management microcredential have demonstrated competency in the application of skills required to maintain quality standards throughout the project lifecycle to ensure delivery of project objectives and client satisfaction. These include creation of quality environments, quality planning, assurance, and control techniques.
90a7e15a-32bf-4aaf-9286-137d47fc6100.name: Project Quality Management

issuer.summary: issued by Northern Alberta Institute of Technology

badge_template_activities.title: Earners must demonstrate competency at an industry entry level by completing a meaningful assessment that includes real-world application.

171cb88e-5b27-4c3a-bd4c-04e2e439b05a.description: Earners of this badge have completed the the Building Intercultural Competence course. The course aims to build intercultural awareness and skills among participants by facilitating learning on topics related to intercultural communications; cultural values; bias, power and privilege; and the importance of the truth and reconciliation process. Participants engage with the materials through personal reflection and guided group discussions. Note: This course is only offered to NAIT staff.
171cb88e-5b27-4c3a-bd4c-04e2e439b05a.name: Building Intercultural Competence: Learning From Each Other

issuer.summary: issued by Northern Alberta Institute of Technology

badge_template_activities.title: Completion of the core activities included in the six week Building Intercultural Competence Course.

3c1caa7e-2ecf-4c15-8e25-a6ffe58442c3.description: Earners of the PLC Ladder Logic Programming microcredential have demonstrated competency in the application of concepts and processes essential for PLC programming by using RSLogix500 software and ladder diagram programming language. Recipients are able to apply discrete instructions (such as permissive statements, latch, unlatch, interlocks or lockouts), timers, counters, compute and compare instructions, and subroutines.
3c1caa7e-2ecf-4c15-8e25-a6ffe58442c3.name: PLC Ladder Logic Programming

issuer.summary: issued by Northern Alberta Institute of Technology

badge_template_activities.title: Earners must demonstrate competency at an industry entry level by completing a meaningful assessment that includes real-world application.

4006cbe9-e850-4b8a-93c8-9108b8218989.description: Earners of the PLC Advanced Programming microcredential have demonstrated competency in the application of concepts and processes essential for using all 4 IEC61131-3 PLC programming languages to implement Ladder Diagram, Functional Block Diagrams (FBD), Structured Text (ST) and Sequential Function Charts (SFC) for discrete instructions, timers, counters, compute and compare instructions, and subroutines.
4006cbe9-e850-4b8a-93c8-9108b8218989.name: PLC Advanced Programming

issuer.summary: issued by Northern Alberta Institute of Technology

badge_template_activities.title: Earners must demonstrate competency at an industry entry level by completing a meaningful assessment that includes real-world application.

4f854329-d4a0-4e38-b441-406eee5e7a4d.description: Earners have demonstrated competency in the application of reliability principles and service quality principles to assure a quality standard. Earners apply risk analysis, reliability, and service quality to incorporate quality into products and services to effectively manage the voice of the customer and assess the different ways a product or service may fail.
4f854329-d4a0-4e38-b441-406eee5e7a4d.name: Quality Design Principles

issuer.summary: issued by Northern Alberta Institute of Technology

badge_template_activities.title: Individuals must demonstrate competency at an industry entry level by completing a meaningful assessment that includes real-world application.

33ab35ee-160b-4a14-8928-a9e478113ebb.description: Earners have demonstrated competency in the application of practical quality management to critical product and service attributes. Earners apply leadership, planning, root cause analysis, and continuous improvement to quality aspects within a working environment to establish and support a quality culture. Recipients analyze quality problems and justify solutions based on quality management principles.
33ab35ee-160b-4a14-8928-a9e478113ebb.name: Quality Management Basics

issuer.summary: issued by Northern Alberta Institute of Technology

badge_template_activities.title: Individuals must demonstrate competency at an industry entry level by completing a meaningful assessment that includes real-world application.

a52e6e38-5493-473b-959c-f45827d83ceb.description: Earners have demonstrated competency in the application of practical quality management to critical product or service attributes. Earners apply acceptance sampling, applied statistics, and statistical process control to measure and monitor quality within a working environment to assure and control quality.
a52e6e38-5493-473b-959c-f45827d83ceb.name: Quality Management Evaluation and Monitoring

issuer.summary: issued by Northern Alberta Institute of Technology

badge_template_activities.title: Individuals must demonstrate competency at an industry entry level by completing a meaningful assessment that includes real-world application.

9e5828a2-cc45-4c80-b950-a35e59c28a9c.description: Earners have demonstrated competency in the application of a system or manual to manage quality in an organization and the application of an audit to assess an organization’s quality management performance. Earners apply quality management systems, process management, business process mapping, and internal auditing to evaluate a quality management system and assess quality management system effectiveness.
9e5828a2-cc45-4c80-b950-a35e59c28a9c.name: Quality Management Systems and Auditing

issuer.summary: issued by Northern Alberta Institute of Technology

badge_template_activities.title: Individuals must demonstrate competency at an industry entry level by completing a meaningful assessment that includes real-world application.
